content:
In the 1980s, the African National Congress (ANC) was labeled a terrorist organization by the United States government, along with several other Western countries, due to its use of violent tactics in the struggle against apartheid in South Africa. The US government's decision to label the ANC as a terrorist organization was controversial and sparked protests from anti-apartheid activists, who argued that the ANC was a legitimate liberation movement fighting against a repressive regime.

However, in 2008, the US government officially removed the ANC from its list of designated terrorist organizations, recognizing the role the organization had played in
